item.title: Ticket #520 (Unable to search words that include apostrophe) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: The search feature in MANAGE cannot find articles with titles containing apostrophe. For example, I have an article titled SpecOps David. Searching "SpecOps David" can't find the article.

item.title: Ticket #519 (encoding goes wrong when using die()) created
item.dc:creator: nbachiyski
item.description: If a script exits with die() the error text is ususally (in IE and sometimes in other browsers) shown in the default browser encoding, which is usually different from the blog encoding. Thus localized error texts are a little bit unreadable.

item.title: Ticket #518 (sanitized link category names could generate non valid xhtml ids) created
item.dc:creator: nbachiyski
item.description: Link category <li>'s id consist only of the category's sanitized name, but unfortunately it could contain % or other forbidden characters. This could lead to generating invalid xhtml code.

item.title: Ticket #517 (blog url set wrong due to SCRIPT_NAME cgi variable unexpected bahaviour) created
item.dc:creator: nbachiyski
item.description:
The SCRIPT_NAME cgi variable does not always return the relative filename of the current script. In some cases, when the script is run in cgi mode SCRIPT_NAME could return something unusable like /cgi-bin/php4-wrapper.

wp-login.php check if the blog's url has changed. In my case the url was automatically changed to <myhost>/cgi-bin

Having in mind that PHP_SELF does exactly what we usually use SCRIPT_NAME for, and also does it awkwardnesses-free I suggest that PHP_SELF is used.

item.title: Changeset [1913]: Mark strings for translation. Bug 514. Patch by nbachiyski.
item.dc:creator: rboren
item.description: Mark strings for translation. Bug 514. Patch by nbachiyski.

item.description: i was having the same problem, but it seems to be fixed now. thanks!

item.title: Ticket #516 (upon first login, direct to 'your profile') created
item.dc:creator: trevorturk
item.description: i think upon first login, you should be directed to 'your profile' and told to change your password. on a side note, it would be nice to prompt for old password before allowing password change.

item.title: Ticket #353 (Wordpress thinks the index page is a 404 page) updated

item.description:
Victory! Yep, does precisely what I'd expect it to, and looks great!

Thanks!

item.title: Ticket #353 (Wordpress thinks the index page is a 404 page) updated
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description: My last diff had inverted logic. Oops. Please try this new one.

item.title: Ticket #515 (Title and Description Should be "Texturized") created
item.dc:creator: orangenormal
item.description: Some output from the bloginfo template tag (such as <?php bloginfo('description') ?> and <?php bloginfo('name') ?>) should be processed with Texturize to replace quotes, apostrophes and other punctuations with their "smart" equivalents.

item.title: Ticket #513 (prev next page on category dont works) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
wp 1.3 2004 12 03 permalink structure: /%category%/%postname%/

/%category%/page/2/ gives me a "Sorry, no entry matched your criteria."

item.title: Ticket #70 (Trackbacks Failing) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: I applyed the patch from ​http://iozblog.ionosfera.com/archives/2004/08/29/wordpress_trackback_fix/ and now trackbacks are running perfectly!

item.title: Changeset [1908]: Move rewrite and permalink functions into WP_Rewrite class.
item.dc:creator: rboren
item.description: Move rewrite and permalink functions into WP_Rewrite class.
